title: Assessing and Managing Water Use and Discharges From Aquaculture Facilities

tasks.task: Farmer performing various tasks in aquaculture and wastewater management.
subtasks: Manage different fish species in various environments (ponds, cages, raceways).
Understand the difference between coldwater, coolwater, and warmwater fish.
Adapt farming practices based on geographical location and available water resources.
Operate recirculating aquaculture systems (RAS) for indoor fish farming.
Monitor and maintain water quality, including dissolved oxygen and temperature.
Implement waste treatment processes for organic waste from fish and feed.
Adjust feeding schedules to prevent excess food from becoming waste.
Utilize aeration systems to prevent oxygen depletion, especially in warmer months.
Manage solids collection and removal from fish tanks and ponds.
Implement best management practices and comply with wastewater discharge permits.
Monitor and manage phosphorus levels in water to prevent pollution and maintain compliance.
